Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for following our requested timeline. Given where we are in the cycle and our remaining availability, we are able to extend you an offer of admission to School_C.

If you remain ready to commit as stated, we are pleased to welcome you to School_C.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_C last. However, we are in round 27 (final window) and still unmatched with quota 1. Given the full market info: Student_D (my top choice) ranks School_C 3rd and is likely to end up at School_D (their 1st) or School_B (2nd). Student_E ranks School_C 3rd but also strongly prefers School_D and School_E ahead; School_D prioritizes Student_B then Student_D then Student_E, so Student_E may still have paths elsewhere. Student_A and Student_B both rank School_C last, so they are unlikely to apply. Historically, no higher-priority student has engaged with us through 26 rounds, making it increasingly unlikely they will in rounds 27–30. Since Student_C is on my acceptable list (though lowest), filling the seat with Student_C now is better than risking ending unfilled, and accepting establishes a match immediately.
